document.topic_text: Entertainment | Lifestyle | Politricks | Social Issues August 22, 2016 Police Recruitment: Aptitude Test Begins Today The Police Service Commission (PSC) will from today conduct aptitude test for shortlisted applicants for recruitment into the police. This is contained in a statement by Mr Ikechukwu Ani, head of Press and Public Relations in Abuja. He said coordinators for the exercise were already in states of deployment to ensure success. He said the commission's Chairman, Mike Okiro had advised successful applicants yet to receive invitation via e-mail, to check their names at states police command headquarters.He said list containing names of invited applicants were pasted in all state command Headquarters.The spokesman said the commission would ensure that no successful and qualified candidate would be left out.PSC shortlisted 110,469 of 338,250 for the aptitude test from 991,438 applications received.The 110,469 applicants comprise 22,454 for Cadet ASPs, 24,456 for Cadet Inspectors and 63,559 for Constables.
